column1: 127kph, back of a length swinging well down the leg side and Harris withdraws the bat
130kph, fuller and swinging down leg again, he tries to glance, it just brushes the pad, misses the bat, Dickwella takes it and there's a big appeal but it's not out
131kph, fuller swinging into leg stump, he clips this neatly and with control through midwicket for two
131kph, good length on middle and leg, he defends from the crease with the angle to mid on
131kph, good length fourth stump line, he defends from the crease under his eyes
130kph, full toss, he drives off the lower part of the bat, punching straight of mid off and they get an easy three
132kph, good length, just wide of off, hint of shape away he leaves this alone
131kph, shorter and wider, shaping away again, he leaves this alone
133kph, good length swinging away, well wide and he's happy to leave again
129kph, short and wide, he cuts getting his hands over the top of it to hit it down to point
134kph, full wide out-swinger, a tempter, he watches go past
131kph, good length, outside off, he presses forward and defends on the front foot
133kph, good length out-swinger, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot with a slightly open face to point
132kph, back of a length wide of off, he leaves raising the bat above his head
132kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
good length out-swinger wide of off, he leaves it alone
132kph, full and fired down leg, Burns falls over a touch trying to glance and misses
129kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending off the sticker of the bat
132kph, back of a length fourth stump line, he defends on the back foot with soft hands
132kph, full out-swinger wide of off, he drives slicing this a touch to point
133kph, fuller length shaping away a touch, he pushes on the front foot towards point
he cuts and gets a thick top edge up and over the slips cordon! It was short and wide, he cuts hard, rolls the wrists but it flies off the top edge over the top safely and away to the rope
shorter on the hip, he tucks this fine and calls 'two mate' immediately and gets back easily

caught at point! Another poorly executed shot! It was a full wide out-swinger, he was tempted into the big square drive, he got down on one knee and crunched it flat and hard and straight to point, Chamika gets low and takes and excellent catch!
beaten all ends up by a 136kph, good length out-swinger! That nipped away late and squared Burns up completely. Superb delivery
131kph, over-pitched, Burns leans into a lovely cover drive, great shape, timing and it's a big gap and it races to the rope
131kph, back of a length, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
131kph, good length outside off, he presses forward and defends with an open face to point
good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
129kph, short and wide, it sticks in the surface a touch, he cuts but mistimes dragging it to wide mid off
130kph, good length out-swinger way wide of off, he leaves happily
129kph, good length, swinging away late, he's squared up a touch defending to point

caught at second slip! This was a lazy stroke. A full out-swinger wide of off, another tempter, Khawaja just wafts his bat at a drive with no footwork, reaching miles away from his body, gets a thick edge that flies head high to slip and the catch is well taken by Mendis who is a good gripper!
133kph, good length swinging into the front pad, there's an appeal but it was pitching outside leg, it runs off pad past short leg for a leg bye
132kph, good length, shaping back a touch, he defends off the back foot
132kph, shorter and wider of off, Burns leaves this alone
133kph, good length out-swinger, wide of off, he leaves this alone
fuller outside off, he checks a square drive placing it behind point, well controlled, they get a couple
134kph, good length wide of off, he's leaving early and confidently
130kph, back of a length, wide of off, he leaves this alone raising the bat above his head
126kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
132kph, full out-swinger, tighter to off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler

thumping square drive on the up through cover-point! Brave shot. 132kph, fuller length angled across, but not a half-volley, he frees the arms and hammers this on the rise. The footwork and balance was good though
back of a length, angled across and he leaves this alone
132kph, fuller shaping into the pads and he clips it to short leg, he fields and fires and Burns has to reach back quickly
shorter length, 132kph, swinging down leg, he tries to glance and misses
133kph, good length swinging into the thigh pad, he can't make contact with the bat and it rolls away
133kph, back of a length on the hip, he tucks this to the man at square leg, he throws at the bowler's end for no reason and the throw was so wide the man backing up couldn't get it! Overthrows
good length lures the edge, defending with soft hands and it runs between third slip and gully and away to third man
130kph, good length outside off and angling back a touch off the seam, he leaves and it's tight to off but a good leave
126kph, shorter length outside off, he's back and across and defending to mid off

caught behind! Chamika has a Test wicket! What a delivery! Good length, angled in, Labuschagne has to press forward to defend, it wobbled and hit the seam, nips away, catches the edge and Dickwella takes the catching moving to his right!
132kph, good length outside off, angled across and he leaves
good length, angled well wide of off, he's happy to leave this alone
130kph, full swinging into the pads and he glances this down to wide long leg
130kph, fired well down the leg side
132kph, good length, coming in off the seam, he's half forward getting a very thick inside edge that runs away behind square, they push for two but only one is available
130kph, short bouncer, wide of off, he thought about pulling but bailed out
129kph, another short ball, bouncer, high and opts not to pull again
132kph, back of a length into the hip, he turns this away with the angle to a deepish leg gully
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, he tries to leave late but can't get the bat out of the way, it comes off the middle and it bounces down on the off side
full and swinging into the pads and Head picks this off, whipping it wide of mid on, nice stroke, he times it superbly and it reaches the rope
128kph, good length angled across wide of off, he leaves this alone
126kph, shorter into the hip, he's back and neatly turning this behind square for a single
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
128kph, good length angled into off stump and he defends again on the front foot
132kph, fuller length outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot to mid off and Chandimal makes a good diving stop
130kph, good length, hint of shape away, he defends from the crease pushing this away to point
130kph, good length wide of off, a touch of shape, Head leaves this well alone

shorter angled down leg, he tickles this fine and thought it was going for four, Chamika makes an effort at full stretch to knock it back twice but the second time he was touching the ball with his feet outside the rope
good length, outside off, angled in, Head leaves, it was tight but a good leave
131kph, good length, he pushes on the front foot back past the stumps, straight of mid on
129kph short and wide and Burns climbs in crunching a back foot drive through cover-point! Lovely shot from Burns. He is very strong off the back foot
129kph, good length wide of off, he leaves alone this time raising the bat above his head
129kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot to mid on
beaten on the inside edge! It was a good length, he prodded at a forward defence, it nipped back sharply, past the inside edge and wide of off stump
128kph, fuller length outside off, he drives firmly to mid off
133kph, good length, angled in and straightening, he pushes on the front foot and slices it a touch to the gap at cover
good length, straight, defended into midwicket
dragged down short outside off but gets away with it as Burns pulls straight to midwicket
that's a good delivery, fill outside off, 130kph, some late swing and Burns defends to point
back of a length, allows Burns to play this off the back foot to cover
full at off stump, defended into the gully
touch shorter outside off, defended towards point
full outside off, 128kph, left alone
in the same spot, lets it go through outside off
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
gets forward into a punchy drive which finds mid-off
excellent shot, takes advantage of some width outside off, square drives behind point
back over the wicket and Head responds with a neat drive straight of mid-off as Karunaratne gets too full
very full, straight, clipped off his toes through midwicket it just gets flicked back before the rope but they run four anyway
good response! Back on a good length outside off, shapes away and beats the outside edge
back of a length outside off, left alone
slips onto the pads, worked off the hip down to long leg and they hustle back for a second
full outside off, strides forward into a confident drive that finds mid-off
short of a length outside off, gentle pace, through to the keeper who takes it low
round the wicket, back of a length, punched off the back foot to the bowler
touch too short outside off, Head rocks back and square drives into the covers
pushed onto the pads, flicked backward of square
better delivery, full at off stump, stretches forward and defends
aggression from Burns as he dances down the pitch and lofts this over long-on...handsome stroke
this time he sweeps, a straight delivery, sends it behind square...deep square dives to try and save it, third umpire will need to check, and he does very well
good length at off stump, defended with a closed face into the leg side
on off stump, good length, defended to the off side
back of a length, straight, plays with the swing into the leg side
a shorter delivery, 129kph, plenty of time for Head to go on the back foot and defend
full and straight, flicked strongly through square leg, wouldn't want to miss that but safely put away
full, very wide, he goes after it but mistimes to mid-off
plays back and defends to the leg side
worked off the pads to short leg
punched off the back foot into the on side
tucked off the pads into square leg
round the wicket, this slides on with the arm, Head leans back and drives into the off side
comes down the pitch and flicks to mid-on
full outside off, plays forward with an open face and the ball runs through backward point
a bouncer which he ducks underneath
a strangled appeal for lbw as this nips back from short of a length, catches Head on the crease but it's too high
goes deep in the crease and punches a length delivery to midwicket
full, too straight, flicked off the pads to long leg
back of a length outside off, 131kph, defended to point
full and straight, worked behind square
short outside off and fetched through the leg side, a strong pull shot that goes wide of mid-on. Saw that very early
full outside off, left alone
back of a length, left alone
length delivery outside off, doesn't play
fuller, outside off, gets onto the front foot and drives to cover
too short outside off, he steps back and square cuts through point
starts to come down the pitch then defends
again he uses his feet, almost yorks himself and drives back to the bowler...he was very keen to use his feet in Brisbane
shorter, stays in his crease, rocks and back and cuts fine of backward point to bring up the fifty stand
round the wicket, on the stumps, defended to the off side

dropped at slip! Was a sharp chance. A delivery pushed across outside off, Burns aiming to force through the off side, takes the top edge and Dhananjaya can't grab it. Big moment for Burns and Sri Lanka
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to the covers
fuller, at off stump, hint of shape in and defended on the front foot
poor delivery, short outside off, Burns doesn't miss out as he cuts behind point
better delivery, back on a full length outside off and swings back but wide enough to leave
wide outside off, left alone
width again outside off and again Burns takes advantage as he square cuts through point...Sri Lanka letting this slip
makes this into a low full toss and flicks it through midwicket, proactive batting from Head
nicely bowled, does Head in the flight as he comes down the pitch
this one goes on with the arm, pushed back to the bowler
gets well forward on off stump and pushes to mid-on
worked off the pads into midwicket
cut from outside off into the covers
drives a full delivery, not in control this time, the inswing means it takes an thick inside edge behind square on the leg side
very full outside off, driven back at the bowler
a short delivery on off stump, gets on his toes, defended towards point
length ball angled across outside off, left alone
short ball outside off, 133kph, not much pace in the pitch or the bowling, Head pulls it from reasonably wide through midwicket
short of a length, straight, gets inside the line and knocks it backward of square
down the pitch and pushes to mid-on
outside off, a touch short, Head places it through the off side with a horizontal bat
driven back to the bowler
comes down the pitch and clips to mid-on
stays in his crease, leans forward and defends
flicked into midwicket
132kph, good length out-swinger, he is forward and defending on the front foot to cover
good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot to mid on
132kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone outside off
134kph, full on leg stump, it hits the foot, they appeal for LBW but it was going well down leg
133kph, good length outside off, hint of shape away, he defends on the front foot with an open face to backward point
132kph, good length wide of off, he leaves alone
131kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
134kph, fuller length wide off, Head thinks about driving but his feet are nowhere and he wisely leaves alone
134kph, good length wide of off, not much swing, he leaves this alone again
133kph, good length angled into off, he defends from the crease to cover
135kph, back of a length wide of off, he stands tall and punches very nicely off the back foot through the gap at cover-point, well timed for a couple
137kph, good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot to mid off
133kph, good length out-swinger but way wide of off, he leaves this alone
134kph, good length wide of off, he presses forward but raises the bat and lets it pass
136kph, good length outside off, fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot away from his body
135kph, good length, top of leg stump, he turns this away forward of square
136kph, fuller length outside off, he drives firmly but straight to mid off
136kph, good length off stump line, he defends from the crease
134kph, good length top of off, he defends from the crease on the back foot
136kph, back of a length wide of off, he punches off the back foot to mid off
short ball and pulled firmly and easily though the vacant midwicket region and away to the rope! Too short and not high enough
136kph, back of a length outside off, he tries to cut but mistimes this to point
134kph, bouncer, better short ball, quicker and higher and well directed and he ducks under it
back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to mid off
fuller on off, he drives inside out, mistiming it to mid off
135kph, perfect length on off stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
wide of the crease, 131kph, good length wide of off and he is not tempted to play
132kph good length away swinger, wide of off, he leaves this alone
137kph, good length angled into middle, he defends from the crease to mid on
short and wide and he cracks an excellent cut shot forward of point! He had to wait a while for that bad ball but cashed in. 50 for Burns. His fifth in Tests to go with three centuries.
just a fraction short and wide and Head plays a beautiful late cut past gully for four! He waited nicely for this and just opened the face and cut it wide of gully along the ground. Great stroke
135kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot
135kph, fuller length angled into middle and off, he works this with the angle to mid on

134kph, fuller outside off, he drives towards mid off, Fernando knocks it down with his hand but it rolls away and Head pinches a quick single! Back-to-back half-centuries for Travis Head. His fifth in Tests also.
lovely glide off the open face between second slip and gully! Good length angled across, he pressed forward to defend and deliberately opened the face and ran it through the gap to third man
streaky top edged pull over the keeper! This was a high bouncer, he tried to pull forward of square, got a top edge that flew over the keeper's head to the sightscreen
139kph, good length, angled across the left-hander, he chops it off the back foot into the off side
134kph, fuller and angled way wide of off and he leaves this alone
135kph, full and wide of off, he drives firmly but straight to the man at cover
135kph, good length angled across the left-hander, he leaves on the front foot
fractionally short and wide and he thrashes his hands through a cut shot nailing it wide of gully for four!
135kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and across and defending to mid off
short and wide, 126kph, he cuts firmly but hammers it straight to cover
over-steps, short and wide again, he cuts with control to deep point
over-steps again, this is shorter into the ribs, he's back easily and turning this around the corner to square leg
fuller outside off, 128kph, he drives on the front foot, mistiming back to the bowler
131kph, full into leg stump, he glances this away off the pads wide of fine leg and picks up a couple
short and wide, 128kph, he's back and cutting but straight to cover
good length, fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot
back of a length, 129kph, outside off, he stands tall to try and punch off the back foot to cover
tossed up, drifting in and he's down the track and drives back to the bowler
fuller, he's forward and defending
he skips down the track and whips against the turn, wide of mid on. There is a misfield and they think about two but it's not on
82kph, tossed up on leg stump, he defends with the minimal spin to short leg
79kph slower on middle and leg, he defends off inside edge onto pad
good length on middle and leg, he pushes on the front foot to midwicket
back of a length on the hip, he's back and tucking this to the gap at midwicket
125kph, short and way wide of off, he reaches out at a front foot cut and toes it to cover
131kph, wide of the crease, angled into off, he defends on the front foot towards mid on
130kph, good length, wide of off, he shoulders arms and lets it go
131kph, fuller length, he leans into a drive, opening the face a touch but he can't beat cover
133kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot cautiously, it comes off inside edge onto pad
84kph, fuller outside off, he's happy to leave this alone
82kph, tossed up on middle, he skips down and drives back to the bowler
flatter and drifting into off, he defends with hard hands on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and cutting firmly to point who is quite deep and they take one
fractionally short and a touch wide, he's back and giving room and punching this beautifully through cover-point and it races to the rope! Lovely stroke
good length on leg stump, he defends towards cover and wants one but Head wisely sends him back
135kph, shorter length on off, he's back and punching firmly down the ground, straight of mid off for four! What a stroke! Great timing and skill to get that to the rope
135kph, shorter on leg stump and he clips this through square leg to deep square
129kph, very full, yorker length wide of off, he tries to squeeze it away and misses
126kph, short of a length outside off, he tries to punch off the back foot but chops it down into the pitch
over-steps 123kph, short and wide, he cracks a cut shot past cover, forward of deep point, Rajitha makes the diving save on the rope
129kph, half-volley and he hammers a cover-drive and Perera makes an outstanding diving save at cover to knock it down and save three
good length outside off, he tries to drive and mistimes it back to bowler
good length, leg stump line, he stays leg side of the ball and defends from the crease
tossed up fuller, he defends on the front foot
tossed up outside off, he skips down to the pitch and lofts this beautifully over mid off! It was a glorious shot. He held his shape so well
good length, on off, he's back and defending from the crease
81kph, on leg stump, he turns this with the spin to the gap at midwicket
82kph, tossed up, he advances and drives to long off
round the wicket, floated up at the stumps, driven to mid-off
tucked into the leg side
touch shorter, stays in his crease and rocks back, drive off the back foot to cover
comes down the pitch and drives to mid-off
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler and he starts with a maiden
starts with a short ball which is crunched through midwicket with a powerful pull
short of a length outside off, driven out to deep point
back of a length outside off, defended
quickly onto the back foot and plays a punchy drive to mid-off
that's another lovely shot down the ground off the back foot, straight of mid-on this time
round the wicket, full outside off, defended
good length at off stump, defended
nudged into the leg side off the back foot
straight, flicked to the leg side
down the pitch and drives along the ground to cover, Chandimal can't stop it cleanly but there's man behind him
leans forward and defends
touch shorter, goes on with the air, pushed to mid-on
a short ball from round the wicket, at the body, Burns swivels on a well-controlled pull behind square
and now wonderfully through the off side! He's charging towards three figures, strides forward and drives square of the wicket on the up
short and wide outside off, he's lucky it's only a single as Burns cuts straight to deep point
a bouncer angled down the leg side
full outside off and Head is onto the front foot, driving through the covers...he's played very well
short of a length outside off, pushed into point
short of a length, driven off the back foot into the covers
full and straight, defended
goes for the sweep, a very full delivery outside off, sends it to deep square
steps back to leg and cuts to point
comes down the pitch and ends up kick this into the off side
full at off stump, defended
over the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended
width out off and that's very nicely played the off side as he steers the drive wide of deep cover with an open face. Into the 90s...
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off
length delivery on off stump, played to the covers
touch fuller, defended on the front foot
short outside off, tries to drag a pull shot but finds midwicket
more neat footwork and he drives to mid-off
round the wicket, full and the stumps, defended
shorter delivery, steps back outside leg and pushed into the covers
pushed off the back foot to the bowler
tossed up full at the stumps and driven to mid-off
short outside leg stump but Burns just nudges it to midwicket
round the wicket, Head plays back to quite a full delivery
dragged down short outside off, Head puts it away square through the off side
straighter delivery, whipped off the stumps into midwicket
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers
fuller, pushed to mid-on
steps across the crease and tucks a straight delivery into square leg
clipped off the pads into square leg
left alone outside off
cut to backward point
short outside off, Head misses out as he cuts to cover and then there's almost a mix-up in the running. All okay in the end. What a way to go that would have been!
round the wicket, pushed back to the bowler
short outside off and he's frustrated to miss out as he drives straight to cover
full outside off, defended on the front foot
on off stump, played back to the bowler
uses his feet and flicks into the leg side
worked off the pads to square leg
on off stump, he plays back and defends
nearly an edge! Skids on outside off, Burns aim to cut, gets beaten over the top edge
uses his feet and defends
shorter, he goes back and plays into the off side
tucked behind square on the leg side
short outside off, picks the gap square of the wicket as he's quickly onto the cut shot. Australia reach 200
defended on the front foot to cover
on the stumps, defended to the bowler
full and straight, neatly flicked wide of mid-on
full outside off, strongly driven to mid-off
length ball, angling into the pads, Burns misses his flick but Sri Lanka's appeal is quickly aborted
what a way to go to 99! A short-of-a-length delivery which he sends rocketing through square leg with a front-foot pull
driven on the up into the covers
good length, at off stump, pushed firmly to mid-on
there it is! Burns has his hundred, Australia's first of the season. A defensive shot which drops into the off side and there's a great moment for Burns
full and straight, defended into the leg side
steps forward and defends
touch shorter, he plays back and pushes into the covers
round the wicket, worked off the pads backward of square
defended on off stump
on the pads, worked to the men behind square on the leg side
flashes and misses with a cut shot, touch of extra bounce as this angled across him
down the leg side, Head can't catch up with it
dropped at gully, maybe just finger tips from Perera. Short outside off, oh dear, this should have been held above his head. Was almost guided to him
full and straight, defended
short, wide outside off, cracked square through the covers
back of a length outside off, defended
defended on the back foot
pushed down the leg side, Head sweeps and gets it very fine
defended into the leg side
fuller, at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
steps back and places this nicely into the covers...had to get his skates on for the second run!
full and straight, carefully forward and defends
135kph, fuller angled wide of off, he leaves this alone, not tempted to play
133kph, full inswinger into leg stump, he glances this to fine leg
good length, 138kph, on middle and leg, he turns this away with the angle to midwicket

slashed in the air but safe between point and backward point! This was a touch loose. It was wide but not a half-volley, he thrashes a square drive in the air but right between the two men stationed either side of point.
135kph, fuller into leg stump, he clips this to midwicket
133kph, good length, fifth stump line, he defends on the front foot with an open face to the gully
tossed up, he skips down and drives straight back to the bowler
he advances to the pitch again and drives to mid off and goes with the stroke
85kph on leg stump, he turns this with the spin to midwicket
tossed up on off, he stretches out and defends
flatter on middle and leg, he turns this with the spin to midwicket
looped up on off stump, he strides forward and smothers the spin
137kph, good length angled across the left-hander, he leaves this watchfully
133kph, fuller length, he cracks a drive on the rise hard to mid off and Chandimal makes a diving save
127kph, bouncer, very short and way down leg
132kph, back of a length, outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
131kph, fuller length outside off, he drives away from his body to cover-point but can't beat the man
133kph, good length outside off, he defends from the crease into the off side
86kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease, not much turn, tucking it to midwicket
angled down leg, he tickles this fine past the keeper and they get three. 200 run partnership
tossed up on middle, he defends on the front foot
not that short but wide and he thrashes a late cut and it flies wide of slip and fine of backward point and races away! He moves to 97
tossed up, drifting to leg, he dances down and defends on the front foot
shorter length on middle, he stands tall and punches firmly back to the bowler
over-steps, 137kph, good length on middle and off, he defends comfortably on the front foot
good length, wide of off, he pushes on the front foot past gully for a single to rotate the strike
130kph, bouncer, high over leg stump, he ducks underneath it
132kph, shorter outside off, he's back and wheeling this with the bottom hand to midwicket
127kph, angled in, fuller length, he turns this with the angle forward of square to the sweeper in the deep
129kph, short ball angled way down leg but he leaves
132kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot

a full toss, he skips down and drives wide of mid off! A boundary to bring up his maiden Test century! After a summer drought, Australia get two centuries within an hour. Head gets his first Test hundred in his second Test as vice-captain
short and wide, he is back and cutting hard backward of deep point
shorter outside off, he's back and punching off the back foot to deep cover-point
tossed up, outside off, he stretches forward and defends
83kph, shorter length, he stays leg side and punches off the back foot to cover
tossed up on middle, he defends on the front foot
overpitched and Head cashes in with a cracking on drive, thumping it back past the bowler and straight of mid on!
131kph, good length, he punches from the crease back to the bowler
shorter length, 128kph, outside off, he stands up and punches off the back foot to mid off
129kph, full wide yorker, he squeezes this out to cover
edged and just short of slip! It was good short ball, banged in and leaving him, he tried to ride the bounce, got an edge as he was squared up and it just fell short of slip diving forward
good length outside off, he tries to drive and drags it off a thick inside edge to mid on
looped up on leg, he skips down to the pitch and whips this into his front pad
shorter length, he's back and pushing this to point
fuller on middle and leg, he defends from the crease
tossed up on leg, he skips down and whips beautifully between the two men at midwicket! He threaded the gap supremely.
tossed up, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
shorter length on leg, he tucks this behind square for a single
132kph, good length, angled in to middle and off, he defends very comfortably on the front foot

131kph, shorter outside off, he cuts firmly hard but straight to cover
132kph, short at the body, he is back and hammers a pull shot behind square to the sweeper
132kph, short of a length outside off, he's back and dropping it close into the off side and Patterson calls him through for a quick one
128kph, short down leg, again, he pulls easily down to fine leg
129kph, fourth stump line, he drives elegantly on the front foot to mid off
skips down the track and works against the turn to wide long on
he skips down and drives neatly to long on with the spin
tossed up, he advances and drives to cover who is deep and they take a tight one beating the throw
fuller on leg, he drives to mid on who is up on the one now
tossed up, he skips out and defends on the move
drifting wide of off, fractionally short, he late cuts very nicely past backward and they cruise back for an easy two
130kph, half-volley outside off, he mistimes a drive slowly to mid off and takes one as the man is sitting deep
130kph, top of leg stump, easily worked around the corner to fine leg
he square drives on the up through point! What a stroke this was! Good length but well wide, he barely moved his feet and just punched with the bottom hand and cracked it forward of point
good length wide of off, he slices this behind point to the sweeper who is back
133kph, full on off, he drives with the full face to mid on
fuller outside off, he drives on the rise to mid off
drifting into middle and leg, he skips down and whips through midwicket and calls two straight away and they get there easily
short on middle, he works behind square to the man near the umpire
fuller on middle, he is forward and defending
shorter on middle, again he's back and working to square leg
slower on off, he leans out and defends with soft hands
looped up on leg, he dances down and stays leg side to drive inside out to long off
full and straight, 148kph, very nicely clipped off his toes through the leg side
length ball, angled into the pads, worked down to long leg
an aborted appeal for lbw a full length delivery spears into the pads, Thirimanne falling across the line, but heading down leg
wrong line, pushed outside leg stump, flicked backward of square and Jhye Richardson does superbly to prevent the boundary, full-length dive running around from long leg
back of a length outside off, 153kph, takes a thick inside edge to leg side. Good pace!
full and straight again, more runs through the leg side, whipped through midwicket. Another long chase, may have been flicked back again with a big dive by Cummins. Expensive start
pushed across full, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, alone
touch fuller, still wide outside off, 139kph, left alone and taken at chest height by Paine
full and outside off, left alone
makes him play, short of a length outside off, defended to point
fuller, he gets onto the front foot, defended to cover
short of a length, worked off the hip to short backward square leg...Harris moved from short leg into that position
a bouncer, very short, climbs over Thirimanne's back and Paine can only palm it behind one-handed
full at off stump, flicked into midwicket
back of a length outside off, 151kph, onto the front foot and pushes to cover for a quick single
short of a length at off stump, 150kph, defended to the off side
short, wide outside off, Karunaratne doesn't even try to keep it down as he cuts up and over backward point
good length outside off, hint of shape away, left alone
hangs it outside off, 137kph, left alone
back of a length outside off, this one keeps down a bit on the way to the keeper
touch fuller, still outside off, shoulders arms
keeps it in the channel full outside off, left alone
pushed across outside off, rinse and repeat, through to the keeper
full at the stumps, 150kph, pushed to mid-on
short of a length outside off, 150kph, taken above his head by Paine
back of a length at off stump, 151kph, defended back to the bowler
touch fuller, at the stumps, played to mid-on...he's targetting the lbw or bowled to Karunaratne
a bouncer on off stump, 148kph, Karunaratne sways out of the line and drops his hands
good length, at the stumps, worked to mid-on
pushed across on a length outside off, left alone
length ball, outside off, he doesn't play...might be worth making him play a bit more
a fuller delivery, but still outside off, Thirimanne takes a step forward and doesn't play
back of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length, 142kph, on off stump and this one requires the bat, goes back and across and defends
changes the angle, he's round the wicket, back of a length angling in at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at the stumps, 149kph, flicked through square leg, splitting the gap between the leg-side catchers either side of square
responds with a short ball outside off, drops his hands
back of a length at off stump, 149kph, defended to cover
this nips back from short of a length, beats the inside edge and hammers into the thigh pad
close run! Direct hit would have been tight. A fuller delivery, he pushed it off the front foot into the covers...Thirimanne out with a direct hit from Head
play and a miss! Pushes this much fuller outside off, encourages the drive and it skims past the bat
over the back, short of a length outside off, pushed square into the off side
straighter, tucked into midwicket
goes after a full, wide delivery, drives it very sweetly square of the wicket through point...the Australians won't mind seeing the attacking intent
back onto off stump, good length, defended on the front foot
a bouncer at 135kph which he ducks underneath
full, wide outside off, left alone
round the wicket, full outside off, defended to mid-on
very full, outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length, angling in from round the wicket, defended with a closed face to the leg side
length ball outside off, makes a small stride and defends
back of a length, heading towards the stumps, worked to the leg side
top shot! That's a fantastic on drive. Cummins goes full at off stump, Karunaratne responds with one of the shots of the match
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended
touch wider outside off, Thirimanne gets a good stride forward as he defends to cover
a bouncer which he ducks to avoid
back of a length outside off, 136kph, defended at the top of the bounce to cover
now it's Thirimanne's turn to play a good on-drive, doesn't quite have the legs to go all the way, came nicely forward into the delivery
another bouncer, 140kph, angled down the leg side
stays round the wicket, good length outside off, touch of extra bounce and it takes the thick inside half of the bat to the leg side
wider, length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, 137kph, defended into midwicket
a bouncer, he goes underneath
good length outside off, 139kph, comes in with the angle but is wide enough to leave
back of a length, takes a thick inside edge and bobbles to the leg side
big turn! Well, well. That's gone a long way. Short of a length at offstump, spins way past the outside edge
fuller, at the stumps, defended on the front door. Already some chirp around the bat
pushed onto leg stump, nudged into midwicket
short of a length, punched into the covers off the back foot
sliced short of backward point! Driving off the back foot, couldn't keep it down
played more solidly into the covers. That's the first of plenty of overs for Lyon
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, neatly punched through the covers
goes up and over the slips! That's very well played. A short ball outside off, Thirimanne ramps it over the cordon down to third man
full, outside off, defended on the front foot
over the wicket, length ball outside off, left alone
angled across outside off, through to Paine
88kph, off break, off stump line, he defends on the front foot into the off side
88kph, shorter length, some turn there, and bounce, he's back and defending off the sticker
87kph, looped up on off, he defends from the crease
87kph, drifting into middle, he defends on the front foot to cover
fuller, he pushes firmly back to the bowler
90kph, shorter on off, he gives room and cracks this firmly off the back foot to cover-point
133kph, back of a length, angled into off stump, he defends from the crease
133kph, shorter length angled into off, he is back and knocking this down into the on side
139kph, back of a length wide of off, he stays side up and gets up on his toes to punch this to cover
137kph, shorter and wider of off, he cuts with an open faced blade on the bounce to gully
140kph, back of a length, off stump line, he is back and across and defending
139kph, good length, top of off, he defends off the front foot with soft hands
88kph, looped up on middle, he pushes a drive inside out to cover
88kph, shorter length, he's back and knocking this to cover-point
86kph, drifting into middle and leg, he steps forward and defends with the full face
89kph, perfect length, he is half-forward defending the turning ball behind point
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover-point
88kph, pushed through quicker and flatter on off, he's forward and defending
138kph, full into middle stump, he clips this into the gap at midwicket and they rotate the strike for the first time since tea
141kph, bouncer, seen early by the batsman and he ducks under it easily
141kph, shorter and wider, he is back and punching nice off the back foot behind point
140kph, fuller length outside off, he steps into a nice front foot push wide of mid off and they take an easy one
142kph, bouncer, he ducks under this early and easily
138kph, shorter outside off, he plays a controlled late cut getting on top of the bounce but he hit it straight to gully on the bounce
90kph, tempting off break outside off, he defends with an open face behind point
89kph, shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this past short leg to the gap at midwicket
90kph, looped higher outside off, he stretched forward and defends into the off side
big spinning off break rips past the outside edge as he defends outside off
88kph, fuller length, he is able smother the spin on the front foot
95kph, flatter and quicker on middle and leg, he is back and bunts this to midwicket for a single
141kph, good length angled across the left-hander, he's not interesting in playing
141kph, back of a length angled across again, he raises the bat high and lets it pass through to Paine
144kph, back of a length outside off, he's up on his toes and punching off the back foot to cover
141kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending but it comes off a thick inside edge onto pad and rolls away
139kph, bouncer, very short and very high and he ducks under it
141kph, good length on off, he's half forward defending off the inside half of the bat, it rolls to a gap forward of square leg for a single
89kph, shorter length wide of off, he punches off the back foot through backward point, neatly timed and placed
drifting into leg stump, he turns this against the spin behind square
89kph, good length off break, he's forward and defends
88kph, shorter on off, he's back and pushing gently to a gap at cover-point for an easy one
89kph shorter length, he's back and cutting nicely but straight to point
87kph, fuller on leg, he defends with firm hands and it just bounces short of Labuschagne at short leg
130kph, on off stump, he's back and punching neatly into the gap between midwicket and mid on for a single
137kph, good length angled across the left-hander, he makes a late call to leave but it passes by with no problem
136kph, good length, angled across, a little wider and an easier leave
magnificent cover-drive on the up! Not that full but width was offered, he leaned into it and caressed through cover-point and it was four the moment it pierced the ring
139kph, good length, tighter to off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
136kph, good length on middle, he defends from the front foot with the full face
87kph, shorter on off, he's back and tucking this past short leg, into the gap, easy one
loop and drop on middle, he reaches forward and defends
88kph, flatter and quicker on middle and leg, he pushes this against the turn wide of mid on
88kph, off break, shorter, he just knocks this towards point who is too deep and they pinch another easy one
90kph, fuller on off, he defends with firm hands back to the bowler
tossed up on off, he defends with an open face towards point
136kph, good length, fourth stump lines, he defends on the front foot
136kph, fuller on middle, he wristily flicks this in the air but wide of midwicket who is reasonably close for a couple
142kph, good length on off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
138kph, good length angled across the left-hander, he leaves
fuller into off stump, he mistimes a drive to mid off
142kph, short ball, bouncer, he ducks underneath it
90kph, shorter length, he's back and punching firmly to cover-point
89kph, slightly shorter, he's back and opening the face placing this to backward point
good length on middle, he's back and working against the turn to midwicket
86kph, fuller on off, he's forward and defending with soft hands
drifting into leg, he works this off the back foot to midwicket
90kph, good length, drifting in and sliding on, he defends on the front foot
good length angling in, 137kph, he's squared up getting a inside edge onto inner thigh
137kph, angled in but down leg, it comes off the thigh guard and runs to fine leg for a leg bye
138kph, fuller on middle, he clips this firmly to one of two catching midwickets, there is a fumble but they opt not to run on the midfield

nearly a mix up! Full into leg, he worked this forward of square, Karunaratne ran but Thirimanne sent him back, fortunately he had time to run halfway down and back before Lyon's throw got to the bowler's end
good length on middle, he defends from the crease towards mid on
fuller outside off, 138kph, he drives but mistimes back to the bowler
tossed up on off, he is forward and defending
he defends with hard hands pushing this into the on side
shorter length, he pushes firmly to cover-point, Burns makes a diving save and Thirimanne is sent back again after some confusion
fuller on off, he pushes firmly to mid off

shorter and wider, he cuts firmly to backward point and Head makes a good diving save
good length, 139kph, angled into off stump, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
136kph, angled into middle and off, he glances this off the stumps with the angle to fine leg
138kph, shorter ball, lifting on off, he's fending off the gloves into the leg side. That hurt. Hit him flush on the right hand
142kph, back of a length on off, he defends from the crease
147kph, good length outside off, he stands up and pushes this from the crease to the gap at cover-point

top edged pull shot flies over the slips! It was 147kph shorter length, it got onto him quickly as he tried to pull, it flew high off the top edge but safely over the slips and ran away to third man for four
88kph, drifting down leg, it comes off the front pad and runs fine for a leg bye
sharper spinning off break, he pushes a defensive stroke, opening the face and pushing it behind point
looped higher and he pushes firmly to cover
shorter length, 90kph, he's back and cracking a cut shot straight to cover-point

outside off, short of a length, pushed into the covers
a bouncer, he ducks underneath

good length, defends and gets an inside edge to the leg side
full at middle and off, defended
aggression as he brings out the slog sweep, doesn't come out of the middle but lands safely towards deep midwicket
left alone outside off
touch shorter, this drifts in and is defended
full outside off and spins away nicely, left alone
good length outside, defended to cover
touch fuller, he comes to drive, the bat face twists in his hand and sends the ball to midwicket
back of a length outside off, defended towards point

gets hit by a bouncer and he's down on his back in the crease. Angled in from around the wicket, he was slow to pick it up, he tried to duck late but turned his head and got hit on the back of the helmet where the neck protector is attached. Immediate concern from the Australia players. Physio and Australia team doctor is out there. May have glanced off his shoulder before contact with the neckn the back of the helmet where the neck protector is attached
good length outside off, 141kph, defended on the front foot

short delivery, angled down the leg side, Chandimal raises his bat and gloves out of the line and it glances off the body. Goes wide of Paine, but called dead ball so no runs can be scored. Think that was probably evasive action
full outside off, left alone
length ball at off stump, defended
brings out the slog sweep, connects very well and sends it to deep square leg
touch shorter, outside off, turns a bit and is defended
a little too short this time, rocks back and drives this very nicely square through point

short of a length, straight, and this loops in the air off a leading edge as Chandimal closes the face
short of a length at off stump, solidly behind the line this time, dropped to the off side and good running
a bouncer, angled down the leg side
full at the stumps, defended
short of a length at the body, tucked off his hip to the man at leg gully
neatly worked away, clipped off his body through square leg

that's less secure! Comes down the pitch and heaves this through square leg
short of a length outside off, defended
gets him onto the front foot, flicked into short leg

huge appeal for lbw! This spins in from outside off, misses Chandimal's flick to leg. Michael Gough says not out and Paine calls for the review. Doesn't look like he's hit it. So will be about point of impact. Could be tight this. The stride isn't huge. Impact is in line, but too much spin! Beating leg stump. And it's fully missing, so Australia lose a review
gets right across outside off and sweeps strongly backward of square...this pair want to be aggressive

what a beauty! Significant inroads for Australia now, and that's a ripper. A back-of-a-length delivery, pitches around off stump, holds its line to beat the outside edge and takes off stump. A lovely delivery.
greeted by a sharp short delivery, 144kph, fended down from around his chest, off the glove
back of a length, straighter, defended on the back foot
139kph, shorter, outside off, pushed into the covers
changes to round the wicket, a short delivery, he goes for the hook and gets a top edge which loops towards long leg
back of a length outside off, 144kph, punched off the back foot to the off side
tossed up outside off, left alone
lovely bowling! Drifts in towards off stump then spins to beat the outside edge
good length at off stump, better stride forward this time as he defends
a shorter delivery and this turns considerably, bit like the first ball he bowled today, Perera gets squared up
defended back down the pitch
good length at the stumps, defended
141kph, over the wicket, short of a length outside off, defended to cover
fuller, outside off, driven to mid-off
defended coming forward
width outside off, short of a length, Chandimal throws his hands through a square drive which goes behind point

edged this time, but wide of second slip and down to third man...length delivery angled across, Chandimal trying to get forward, lack of pace in the surface won't help the ball carry. Starc manages a smile
150kph, very full outside off, driven to mid-off
full at the stumps, defended to point
a shorter delivery, plays back and drives to mid-on
defended to the off side
fuller, brings a drive which finds cover
dragged down short outside off and that's put away square through the off side
goes to play square into the off side again and almost carries to Burns at cover
round the wicket, left alone outside off
short outside off, gets onto his toes and square drives to point

angled into the pads from round the wicket, worked backward of square
over the wicket to the left hander, straight, defended to cover

uses his feet, can't get to the pitch, kicks it away to the off side

round the wicket, at middle and leg, defended off an inside edge
short outside off and that's send through covers, Kusal steps and cuts well in front of square
better length, on off stump, forward and defends
round the wicket, short of a length outside off, left alone
short outside off, driven hard into the ground and it bounces up to point

full and straight, 153kph, played to the off side
short of a length outside off, 150kph, defended on the back foot
full outside off, defended on the front foot
what a ripper! That's unplayable. Turns from around middle stump, beats the edge and bounces over off stump
that's well played, a late square drive runs behind point
another one which turns, delivered from wider on the crease, angled in at off stump
much more air, very full, pushed to cover
lovely piece of bowling, has the batsman in two minds, late decision to leave as this spins away outside off
more confidently left alone to end Lyon's work for the evening
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
148kph, fuller and outside off, defended
a shorter delivery, 145kph, hops on the back foot and drops it into the off side
short of a length, down the leg side, Kusal stays inside the line

over the wicket for the last ball of the day, full outside off and driven to cover

136kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending a little hurriedly into the off side

he's hit on the helmet trying to pull! He's OK. It was a quick bouncer, he tried to pull, it came off the glove onto the shoulder and then the helmet, the neck protector attachment flies off the helmet and falls safe, as does the ball. He was fine. Just a glancing blow
good length, top of off, he's back and across and he defends into the off side
134kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends very nicely off the back foot
good length, 139kph, fourth stump line, he presses forward and he defends with soft hands
short ball and he swivels on a pull and places this beautifully behind square! Textbook shot. 140kph, short into the chest region, he pulled very well. Played that with ease

145kph, higher bouncer, he tries to pull again, gets hit on the helmet and it flies away to fine leg! He's fine and runs to the other end. Not sure that should have been given a runs. There was no bat. Should have been a leg bye
142kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot
good length, outside off, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
136kph, fifth stump line, good length, he defends in a compact position

141kph, fuller length outside off, he defends on the front foot to point
