144kph, fuller length outside off, he defends from the crease, hanging back a touch
141kph, bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks under neath it
144kph, bouncer, over off stump, he ducks under it pretty well

nearly a catch at midwicket! Harris got finger tips to it! It was full on middle and leg, he chipped it in the air over midwicket, Harris jumped up, full stretch vertically and gets his finger tips on it but it flies away for four!
good length on off, he defends on the front foot
wide of the crease, 136kph, good length angled into off, he pushes firmly turning the bottom wrist to work it to mid on
shorter into the ribs, 138kph, he gets inside the line, raises the front knee and plays a controlled pull to fine leg
136kph, bouncer, climbing quickly and angled in, he tried to pull but it got too big on him and flew over his head

thumped at head high past cover! Wow! This was an amazing strike. It wasn't a half-volley but there was width, there was no footwork, he just thrashed his hands through it and smacked it straight of cover like a bullet!
142kph, good length wider of off, he defends playing a touch away from his body to cover
143kph, cracking bouncer over off, he went to defend and then swayed under it late getting his head out of the way
fuller outside off, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
145kph, good length, nipping back, he's caught on the crease, gets an inside edge onto pad and it rolls behind square. Half an appeal but they knew there was an inside edge
145kph, beaten, this was a good length across him but stayed a touch lower, he groped at it with an angled bat and it beat the inside edge but was wide of off
144kph good length on a fourth stump line, he defends firmly to cover
135kph, short ball, head high, he takes it on and pulls well rolling the wrists hitting it to wide fine leg
135kph, fuller, drives in the air again but straight of cover once more in the gap, Head chases from mid off and hauls it in. Perera pushed out away from his body there with his weight back
135kph, fuller length angled into middle, he defends with the full face, that might have stayed a touch lower
135kph, full angled down leg, he flicks this in the air down towards fine leg but it lands well short of the man

edged and it runs along the ground between the lone slip and gully to the third man boundary! Good length wide of off, he drives firmly at it, gets a thick edge but it went down and straight in the gap
beaten by a 136kph, good length delivery, angled in and just straightened a touch. He was caught on the crease and just poking at it
back of a length wide of off, he's back and pushing away from his body to backward point
144kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends trying to get forward
145kph, good length, angled into middle and off, he defends from the crease playing late with the full face
143kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends from the crease back to the bowler
144kph, outstanding bouncer that followed him, he went to pull but played it well, dropping the hands and swaying the head out of the way
143kph, bouncer, angled down leg, again he shapes to pull but bails out and Paine takes it high above his head
tossed up on off, he is forward and defending
drifting down leg and he sweeps firmly behind square! Excellent shot. He was quick to get down and smoke this behind square
shorter length, 86kph, he's back and cutting to backward point
88kph, looped up higher on outside off, he square drives to deep point
90kph, quicker off break on off, he defends working this to short leg
shorter outside off, he's back and defending behind point
high bouncer outside off, he tries to pull but is beaten for pace and bounce and it flies through to Paine

he's hit flush on the helmet ducking into it! It was another quick short ball, angled in, it doesn't get up, he ducks straight into it, it hits the grill of the helmet. The neck protector attachment flies off but goes wide of the stumps. He's fine. Doesn't go to ground. Richardson checks on him. He says he's OK. The doctor is now out there. He'll be fine to continue here but is getting a new helmet.
140kph, bouncer, but much higher, he ducks underneath it easily this time
back of a length on leg stump, he's cramped but tucking this behind square to leg gully
cracking pull shot behind square and Burns makes a great diving save on the rope to save two. Good shot. Swivelled on it quickly and hit it down
144kph, into the hip, he turns this around the corner to leg gully
86kph, tossed up outside off, he works this with the spin to midwicket
89kph, tossed up, outside off, he pushes firmly back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, 87kph, he's forward and defending
90kph, shorter length, he's back and giving room and punching to cover-point
shorter ball, he's back and pulling hard through square leg and past short leg, the man in the deep cuts it off
89kph, tossed up on off, he stretches forward and defends
angled into middle and leg, he plays from the crease, working this with the angle wide of leg gully to fine leg
139kph, short ball chest high, he's jumping back and defending to midwicket
shorter length outside off, he punches off the back foot straight of mid on, nicely played
140kph, shorter down the leg side, he tries to pull but can't catch up with it
shorter length into the thigh guard, he tries to pull but it comes off the thigh guard and flies behind square for a leg bye
142kph, short ball, outside off, he pulls with control forward of square to the man in the deep
89kph, tossed up outside off, he skips down the track and defends
beaten fending at a length ball that bounces but doesn't spin that much outside off
shorter length, spinning in to middle, he's back and giving room to punch firmly through cover-point
tossed up, 88kph, he steps out and defends
shorter length on off, he's back and defends with soft hands
90kph, shorter length, on leg, he is back and turning this past short leg
fantastic stroke! Great way to go to fifty as he strides forward and drives on the up square through the off side. Terrific stuff
and now he drives through mid-on, full delivery, neatly played with a straight bat
round the wicket, 147kph, full and straight, defended
angled into the pads, flicked through square leg
short of a length, straight, defended into midwicket
a shorter delivery, angled in at the body from round the wicket, worked off the hip backward of square
works a straight delivery into square leg
starts a touch wider outside off, spins and is defended on the back foot
played back to the bowler
uses his feet and is nowhere near the pitch of the ball so kicks it away, the balloons up and isn't far from brushing the glove as it loops to the off side
tucked off the back foot into square leg
that's a super shot, he skips down the pitch and lofts straight down the ground
149kph, round the wicket, full outside off and driven back down the pitch

what's happened here? He's out hit wicket I think! It's the short ball again, Dhananjaya is beaten for pace as he tries to pull. The ball glances off the glove or helmet and then as the bat swings around it clatters into the top of the stumps. Must have taken the helmet because Paine caught it. Either way, it's out. Not sure why Dhananjaya hung around, really, but was a very quick confirmation from the third umpire. Was clearly in the motion of playing the stroke, which is what's required for hit wicket
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
short, climbs down the leg side, not too far from the glove
caught a gully, Starc is getting back! Full, wider outside off, a real tempter and Karunaratne goes for the drive, skews it in the air for a comfortable catch
151kph, round the wicket, speared down the leg side
goes for the reverse sweep, a full and straight delivery, makes good contact and it's well fielded at cover by Burns
full outside off, draws him forward, defends
straighter, worked off the pads to square leg
touch shorter outside off, he defends and the ball bobbles back quite close to the stumps

and another, thick inside edge which loops to leg slip! Regulation stuff from Lyon, but lovely bowling. Plenty of overspin, starts outside off, turns and takes an inside edge into the pad which loops up to Starc
plays a late cut to a ball outside off, guides it on the bounce towards slip. Risky
full outside off, pushed firmly into the covers
another short one which hits the batsman, round the wicket, Perera ducks and is taken on the shoulder
takes another blow, this was short of a length, Perera was in two minds whether to play or duck, glances off the shoulder of the bat into his helmet grille
146kph, outside off, short of a length, defended
gets across to off stump and defends a back-of-a-length delivery to backward point
short and outside off, climbs through to Paine
short of a length, steps back to leg and drives into the covers...they don't take the run on offer
beats the outside edge with one that spins sharply
dries square into the off side and this time they take the run
forward on off stump and defends into midwicket
back of a length, wider outside off, defended
takes a stride down the pitch and launches this over midwicket
good shot, full outside off, punched straight of mid-off
round the wicket, short outside off, defended somewhat unconvincingly towards point
behind the line, defended on the back foot
146kph, short of a length outside off, climbs past the outside edge, tries to drop the gloves but he was certainly beaten
144kph, very short, this one sails through to Paine
short, angled into the body, fended down the leg side and wide of a diving Paine
there's the slog sweep, he connects well and sends it racing out to deep midwicket
dragged down short outside off, he rocks back and cuts in front of square...deep point gets across
full, outside leg stump, conventional sweep which goes through short fine leg
full and straight, touch slower, pushed back to the bowler
pushed down the leg side, a paddle-sweep this time, more work for the man at short fine
back on a good length at off stump, defended into the covers and he's able to nab the strike
dropped at slip by Khawaja! A simple chance. Short of a length outside off, almost guided straight to him, it's in front of his face and it bounces straight out of the hands
a short ball outside off, 145kph, he sways out of the line
147kph, short of a length outside off, defended to cover
pushed down the leg side
short, wide outside off, back cuts it wide of gully and it runs to third man
that's a good short one! On an off stump line, Dickwella does well to get out of the way. Starc offers a few words. Probably 'well played'
good length, straight, pushed to deep midwicket
big appeal for the bowler as he sweeps a full, straight delivery, runs very fine...only the bowler appeals, Paine says 'it's all bat!'
reverse sweeps a delivery that's around leg stump, sends it to deep point
back of a length, straight, defended on the back foot
full, defended on the front foot
full outside off, slides off an open face behind point
good length outside off, defended with a good stride
an appeal for lbw as this spins quite sharply, beats the inside edge. Perera quite a long way back in his crease. Maybe doing too much
defended down by his feet
forward and defends with bat and pad together
defended and runs off a thick inside edge to the leg side
pushed back down the pitch

that's pretty straight, and given lbw! Misses the sweep, but he has called for the review. A full delivery, pitches around middle. Ah, has this taken the glove before the pad? There's a very small murmur on Snicko. Is that enough to overturn? Third umpire rocking and rolling this. Says it's not conclusive. Taking shows it's hitting the top of middle so that stays on-field!
full wide leg break, 84kph, it's left alone, Paine can't glove it cleanly
91kph, shorter leg break, he's back and defending to cover
85kph, full wide leg break, he tries to drive but it spins sharply past the edge
wrong un on middle and off, he defends on the front foot off the inside edge to short leg
beaten again by a big ripping leg break. Beautifully bowled
caught behind! 140kph, warm up delivery, short and wide, Perera tried to cut, got a thin edge through to Paine and it's a very simple catch. That was all a bit too easy.
146kph, back of a length angled in and just straightening a touch, he is squared up and playing way inside the line

Bowled him! Five for Starc! 148kph rocket, angled in on a good length, just straightened off the seam a touch, he was caught leg side of it, groped at it as he was squared up, it beat the outside edge and crashed into the top of off!
124kph, short into the hip and he's back and tucking this easily behind square to get off the mark
127kph, full and angled across, not much shape, he leaves this alone
131kph, shaping into leg stump, he glances this to fine leg easily
130kph, good length wide tempting out-swinger, Harris opting not to play
129kph, good length out-swinger wide of off, he defends away from his body towards point
129kph, good length on middle and off, he pushes gently on the front foot wide of mid on and takes an easy one
131kph, full and shaping back into him and he punches on the front foot, barely more than a push past the bowler, straight of mid on for three
130kph, back of a length, middle and leg, he works this behind square and wants one but Harris sends him back
over-steps, 131kph, good length out-swinger wide of off, he leaves this alone
130kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and trying to cut mistiming to point
130kph, fuller out-swinger fourth stump line, he presses forward and defends to cover
130kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and defending solidly
133kph, full, half-volley on middle, he mistimes this, shovelling it towards mid on
122kph, good length, top of off, he turns this around the corner to the man behind square
full out-swinger, outside off, he defends with soft hands
shorter length, 130kph, angled down leg and he glances fine of fine leg for four. Easily done. No swing and he just picked this off his thigh pad
129kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and tucking this down to fine leg
131kph, good length, wide of off, he's happy to leave it alone
130kph, back of a length, angled across, he leaves comfortably again
short and wide and cracked through backward point! He got over the top of it, played it down and placed it well
132kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across and punching this with the bottom hand to mid on
134kph, fuller outside off, he drives firmly on the front foot to mid off

edged and caught at second slip! Superb catch diving forward by Mendis! 131kph, fuller length wobbling outside off, he doesn't get a good stride in, tries to drive firmly away from his body, it just nips off the seam a touch, gets a thick edge that flies low to second slip and Mendis coming forward takes another outstanding catch!
129kph, shorter length, it kicks up off a length, he's squared up and he knocks it down on the back foot. He was surprised by the bounce
133kph, good length across the left-hander, he leaves this alone
129kph, shorter length, angled across, Burns is defending away from his body with an angled bat, chopping this down off a thick inside edge into the leg side
127kph, good length, angled across the right-hander, he leaves this alone
131kph, good length angled across and he leaves alone
nearly chopped on! He tries to drive away from his away from his body, gets a thick inside edge onto pad and it ricochets just past off stump! That was so close!
back of a length on off, he's back and working this through wide mid on
133kph, good length, off stump line, he's back and defending from the crease
back of a length, top of off, he's back and nudging this with the bottom hand wide of mid on and pinching a single. Fernando hit at the bowlers end but Burns was home easily
129kph, bouncer, wide of off, Khawaja didn't pick it up early, but he ducked easily enough
132kph, wide half-volley, he reaches out to drive with minimal footwork, mistimed a drive to cover
full and miles wide of off and he leaves and it's called wide
130kph, good length angled across and he leaves alone
128kph, bouncer hits him on the shoulder! He went to ride the bounce and it got big on him, he dropped the gloves under it and gets pinned on the shoulder with both feet off the ground
good length angled across and he leaves this alone
high bouncer, and he pulls from above his head rolling the wrists behind square for a couple
not quite as high a short ball and Burns cracks this infront of square, well timed and well wide of the man near the square leg umpire
good length across, he plays slightly away from his body pushing to point
good length, top of off, he defends from the crease

caught at second slip! Another sensational catch from Mendis! Unbelievable. Good length, angled across, he was caught on the crease, it just nipped off the seam, caught the edge and flew low to Mendis' left, it wouldn't have carried to first, he dives low to his left and takes a stunning catch. Well bowled and well caught.
132kph, good length angled across him, he's unsure whether to play or leave and he leaves late
130kph, good length angled well wide of off, he is happy to leave
130kph, good length, top of off, he is forced to defend from the crease
131kph, full swinging into leg stump and he whips this behind square! Attempted yorker, just too leg side and he clipped it well

top edged pull shot lands safe short of fine leg! This was a short ball, chest high, he tried to pull, rolled the wrists early, got a top edge that flew straight up, high towards fine leg, but the man couldn't get there running in and it was too far away for Dickwella to get across. Some luck for Khawaja
good length, fifth stump line, he makes a good stride and leaves
good length, on off, he defends on the front foot
127kph, bouncer, well directed, he ducks underneath it
good length, angled into the top of off, he hangs back and defends towards to mid on
129kph, good length, out-swinger wide of off, he leaves on the front foot
good length, angled into middle and leg, he tucks this through square leg to the sweeper
fuller length, 131kph, tighter to off, he makes a good stride and defends under his eyes
131kph, good length angled across the right-hander, he leaves alone
80kph, good length, sliding into leg, he's back and working this to midwicket
78kph, looped up on middle, he stretches out to defend
shorter 80kph, on off, he's back and punching to mid off
81kph, looped up on middle and leg, he defends from the crease just plonking the bat down
good length off break, he's back and punching this firmly back to the bowler
good length, 83kph, just outside off, he's back and forcing this to cover
angled across outside off, left alone
fuller, he comes forward and drives to cover
back of a length at middle and off, defended
pushed across outside off, short of a length, shoulders arms
touch fuller, outside off, left alone
tight to off stump, plays forward and defends to cover. Labuschagne still yet to score
well bowled! Plays back to a pretty full delivery, he's squared up and it slides off a thick outside edge
comes down the pitch, lofts this over mid-on, doesn't quite get the timing. He didn't run initially, thought it was four
uses his feet again, clipped to midwicket
good length, angled in at off stump, defended on the front foot
touch shorter, he plays back and into the off side
steps down the pitch then pushes to mid-on. Good contest
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
straighter delivery, on a good length, worked to midwicket
strides forward and drives to point
a shorter delivery outside off, shapes to cut it but he's a little cramp for room and finds point
over the wicket, good length at off stump, big stride forward as he defends solidly
and he's off the mark from his 17th ball, gets a little too full and straight, clipped strongly through midwicket
full and straight, pushed to mid-on
pushed into the pads, worked through square leg
goes back and tucks a straight delivery to midwicket
full at middle, pushes the bat forward in front of the pad
outside off this time, full length, defended to cover
this keeps a bit low! Although Khawaja again playing deep in the crease. Just manages to bring the bat down
good length at off stump, a touch squared up as he defends
pushed down the leg side, Labuschagne can't catch up with it
full outside off, 130kph, defended
edged, caught behind! Australia three down for not many again. In the channel outside off, he's been solid so far but feels for this and it's a neat catch to Dickwella's right. Very loose stroke
a sharp bouncer first ball, 135kph, over middle and Head ducks
back of a length outside off, driven to mid-off
left alone outside off
down the pitch and works through midwicket, Head has to get a shift on but it's safe in the end
good length at off stump, stretches forward
short of a length, he plays back and to the bowler
played to the off side
down the pitch and clipped to mid-on
full outside off, defended
that's a terrific pull shot, quickly onto the short ball and hammered through square leg
very wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, he's across the crease and defends
gets forward and drives to cover
short on leg stump, he gets inside the line and clips it off the hip to fine leg. Chamika can't haul it in. Big no-ball as well
round the wicket, full and wide, left alone
short outside off and nicely put away, skips back in the crease and square cuts
full at off stump, defended
down the pitch, superb footwork, the shot of a man in form as he drives delightfully between cover and mid-off
stays in the crease this time, leans forward and defends
very full, flicked to mid-on
good use of the crease, goes back and places this drive through cover but the sweeper keeps it to a single
short, wide outside off, gets a bottom edge as he cuts and it rolls to Dickwella
comes round the wicket and finds the bottom edge again as Head looks to force it off the back foot through the off side
wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, another no-ball, defended to mid-on
short of a length outside off, he's on the back foot and pushes to point
fuller, outside off, left alone
a short ball, he ducks underneath
over the wicket, length outside off, worked to midwicket
short of a length outside off, pushed from the back foot to mid-off
across to off stump and defends towards point
fuller delivery, outside off, comes forward and drives to mid-off
short of a length at off stump, 131kph, punched to mid-on
full outside off, Head quite a long way across the crease, pushes to cover
full at off stump, driven to cover
short outside off, cuts to point
full at the stumps, whipped back to the bowler
plays back and works off the pads to square leg
a touch short, he pulls but picks out square leg
some width outside off, square cuts and again finds the man at point
a bouncer, through to the keeper
length ball angled across outside off, left alone
almost nicks through to the keeper as he drives on the up at another one pushed across
a short delivery, gets on his toes and defends back down the pitch
drives this to cover, played on the walk
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off. A maiden. Australia haven't been allowed to get a shift on
round the wicket, full outside off, defended
driven to the off side
full at off stump, a stronger drive this time finds cover
that's too short, a simple delivery to put away as he pulls through midwicket. A freebie
full at the stumps, clipped behind square
left alone outside off
123kph, bouncer, well directed, he swivels and pulls down behind square, there's two men back
over-steps short and wide, he cuts firmly towards point and it just pitches short of Dimuth Karunaratne who knocks it down
over-pitched and he leans into a lovely cover-drive! Sensational stroke. Cracked it past the man at cover through the packed off side field
fuller on middle and leg, he clips this very firmly straight to mid on
131kph, back of a length outside off, he's back and pushing away from his body through point to the sweeper who is back now
128kph, over-pitched again wide of off, and he reaches out and nails a cover drive in typical Khawaja fashion, flowing the wrists through the line past cover and away to the rope
shorter length on off, he's back and defending with the full face of the bat
lopped up outside off, he skips out and drives to mid off who is quite deep and they run well to get an easy one
fuller drifting into off, he's back and playing from the crease, defending
tossed up on off, similar length, he's forward to defend this
83kph, good length again, he's back and defending with the straight bat
skips down in hope to one that turns, closes the face, gets an outside edge that runs well wide of slip towards third man
84kph, good length, on off, sliding on, he's back and working this with the angle into the leg side
fuller angled into off, he is half-forward mistiming a drive to cover
over-steps, short and wide and he cuts very firmly to deep point
130kph, short ball outside off, he cracks a pull shot hard but straight to the man at wide mid on. A couple of metres wide and it would have raced away
126kph, good length, off stump line, he strides forward and pushes firmly to mid off
a misfield at cover from Thirimanne! This was a lovely cover-drive but hit straight to cover, Thirimanne dives to his left and it goes straight through his hands and under his body and runs away
good length angled across him wide of off, he leaves this alone
128kph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot firmly towards mid off
85kph, looped up on off, he skips down and works this against the turn through midwicket
85kph, off break, drifting in, towards off, he defends on the front foot
he's back quickly seizing on the slightly shorter length, he cuts hard past backward point and gets it away! Good footwork to create the shorter length
83kph, full on middle, he works against the turn towards long on
shorter length, he cuts, mistiming this but placing it into the gap at cover-point
full and drifting into middle, he steps forward and defends on the front foot
85kph, tossed up outside off, he skips down and drives very firmly to wide mid off but can't beat the man for more than a single
82kph, looped up higher and slower on off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
shorter outside off, he's back and punching this wide of cover into the gap
shorter and wide, he's back and cracking a cut to deep point
83kph, tossed up wide of off, a tempter, he leaves this alone
shorter, a bit more turn, he's back playing it off the pitch and cutting to deep point
124kph, good length angled into leg stump, he glances this comfortably with the angle down to fine leg
128kph, fuller on middle and off, he glances this off the stumps to fine leg
124kph, angled into middle, he flicks this from middle through square leg to the sweeper
129kph, top of middle, he's back and working this comfortably behind square

drives in the air just wide of cover! It was a half-volley, it just stopped a touch in the surface, he got through it early but middled it in the air past the diving man at cover and it raced to the rope
129kph, fuller length on middle, he drives, playing it later to mid off
tossed high, he gets there on the full and drives off the toe of the bat back to the bowler
tossed up on leg stump, he drives to the catching straight mid on next to the pitch
shorter length, he punches off the back foot to cover
full toss, he skips down and drives firmly back past the bowler, straight of mid off and long on runs around to cut it off
fuller on leg, he defends off the inside half of the bat to the gap at midwicket
shorter and wider of off, he is back and cutting to deep point. 50 for Khawaja

nearly a run out trying for two! This was full and wide, he drive through point and they push for two, Chamika does the fielding and fires to the bowler's end and Head was miles out but the throw missed and no one was there to take the throw!
full, speared into middle and off, he gets an inside edge onto pad
over-pitched and he reaches out and cracks a lovely cover-drive! The sound this made off the back was incredible. Just a pure strike.
127kph, good length on leg stump, he works this off the pads easily forward of square to the sweeper
124kph, bouncer, too high and angled down leg and called wide
good length, top of off, he punches off the back foot to mid on
130kph, half-volley on leg stump, whipped away firmly through square leg to the man in the deep
85kph, shorter length, he's back and forcing this straight to cover
short and pulled powerfully through midwicket to the big gap and finds the rope! That was a drag down and Head was quick to swipe this through midwicket
short again outside off, he's back and cracking this to deep point
good length outside off, he defends from the crease away from his body
full toss, driven to cover, he misfields, knocking it away from mid off for a single
fired into leg stump, he's back and chopping this off the inside edge onto pad and it rolls away
128kph, angled down the leg side and Khawaja lets it go
good length, on off, he defends from the crease squared up a touch
129kph, bouncer, angled in at the body, he ducks under it well
131kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he opens the face with a vertical bat and runs it toward third man but Mendis makes a good diving save at gully
glorious straight drive! This was over-pitched on middle and leg, he leaned into it and caressed it down the ground straight of mid on. Superb stroke
127kph, bouncer again, he ducks underneath it
dropped by Dickwella! Good length off break, pitching outside leg, he's caught on the crease, it spins sharply, catching the edge and Dickwella can't hold on!
shorter length wide of off, he's back and cutting hard to deep point
83kph, shorter outside off, he's back and punching this to deep cover point
tossed up on leg, he skips down and defends
looped up again, he skips out and drives straight to mid off
tossed up outside leg, big spinning off break, he's forward then back and knocking this down
132kph, good length, pushed to the gap at cover-point and they stroll through for one, Dhananjaya fires at the bowler's, hits the stumps when Khawaja is in and they get an overthrow on the ricochet
shorter length outside off, he gets on top of the bounce, late cutting straight to gully
short and wide, he cuts firmly through backward point to deep square
bouncer, way down the leg side and called wide
short on the hip, 128kph, he's back and working this behind square to the sweeper in the deep
132kph, short and wide, he cuts very nicely fine through backward point, the man in the deep has to run around and cut it off
131kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and working this through midwicket for a single
130kph, fuller on middle and he whips brilliantly through the gap at midwicket, lovely timing to get this to the fence!
85kph, darted in shorter on off, he's back and giving room, cutting to backward point
tossed up on off, 83kph, he stays back and defend from the crease
83kph, drifting into leg, he turns this against the spin to short leg
tossed up, on middle, he drives back to the bowler
83kph, sliding on with the angle, he's back and taken on the pad but it's missing leg stump and there was barely an appeal
shorter on off, he's back and whipping this against the spin to midwicket
132kph, length ball swinging back late, he is cramped cutting to the floating slip on the bounce
full, 131kph, swinging way down the leg side
132kph, fuller and wider, he gets down on one knee and slays a square drive to deep point
134kph, good length outside off, he drives with ease inside out to deep point
130kph, bouncer, he ducks under it early and it flies through to the keeper
132kph, another bouncer, he ducks underneath again, it flies harmlessly to the keeper
84kph, tossed up drifting in, he drops the bat on it smothering the spin
84kph, tossed up on middle and leg, he pushes a drive easily to long on
pitching outside leg, he's unsure stretching forward to defend
shorter length, he's back and slapping it hard to cover
tossed up on leg, he skips down and drives back to the bowler
fired down leg, 86kph, it comes off pad and runs to a fine short fine leg
132kph, good length, angled into off stump, he works this with the angle to midwicket
130kph, good length angled into off, he is striding forward and driving to mid on
131kph, back of a length on off, he's playing from the crease working to midwicket
131kph, bouncer, well directed, he sways underneath inside the line
131kph, length ball angled well down the leg side, Khawaja can't clip it away
133kph, fuller angled into off, he drives from the crease, mistiming this one to mid on
tossed up outside leg, he skips down and whips against the turn to midwicket
looped up outside leg, he stretches out from the crease and defends on the front foot
he skips down the track and lofts this beautifully over mid off! He stayed leg side and just lifted it in the air through straight mid off
full outside leg, he sweeps hard straight to short fine leg
85kph, tossed up, he dances down and drives firmly back to the bowler
tossed up outside leg, he defends on the front foot
good length angled into middle and leg, he's back and working this behind square to deep square
133kph, back of a length outside off, he stands tall and punches off the back foot to mid off

cracking pull shot forward of square! This was a head high short ball, he jumped all over it smashing it flat in front of square. The man behind square on the rope didn't have far to move but it beat him
good length wide of off, he flashes hard, slashing a square drive to deep point
131kph, bouncer, straight over off stump, he ducks under it
thick inside edge past leg stump! It was a good length, he tried to square drive, get a thick inside edge that flies safely past leg stump to fine leg
over the wicket, reverse swept backward of point, rolled his wrists nicely
now he brings out the conventional sweep, played very strongly backward of square leg
worked off the pads behind square
steps back to a shorter delivery, drives to long-off to take him to fifty which continues an outstanding match
steered through point with an open face
full and straight, defended
he's going for the ton here, a flowing drive on the up through the covers, lovely-looking shot
finds mid-off with the drive this time
short outside off, he drags the pull to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched back to the bowler
full, wide outside off, Head goes right across his crease and drives to cover
angled into the pads, worked to deep square so he steals the strike off Khawaja
opens the face and dabs into point
nails a reverse sweep but straight to the man at backward point
tapped off the pads to midwicket
reverse sweeps again, this time backward point is beaten by the spin and lets it through
short outside off, cracks a cut shot and there's another misfield at backward point which gifts a boundary. Takes him into the 90s
tries to whip away a full delivery, gets an inside edge into his boot
wide outside off, steered wide of the lone slip down to third man...think he was just trying to get the single! Lead is over 500
full and wide, a crunching drive finds cover
a short ball outside off, 128kph, he ducks
another short one outside off, he sways out of the line
gets across the crease and works a back-of-a-length delivery to deep square
moves away outside leg stump and guides a short ball in the air fine of third man, a one-day style ramp
driven back to the bowler
worked off the toes to deep square leg, potentially four balls for Usman
round the wicket, on the pads, tickled away through short fine leg and he makes it into a three to move to 99
pushed off the back foot to cover
goes back, pushes to cover and can't get the single
comes forward and pushes to midwicket
full on the pads, worked to deep square and there is the hundred! A massive roar from Khawaja as he hit that ball. Quite emotional celebrations
a big full toss, worked to deep square leg
a short ball over leg stump
a low full toss is worked off the pads
another short one, 126kph, loops over Head's head
slower ball, full outside off, driven to mid-off
146kph, full at off stump, hint of swing, defended to mid-off
wider outside off, good length, but it's the swing that will excite Starc as it goes through to Paine
good length, 144kph, straight and defended
fuller, at the stumps, clipped firmly to wide mid-on
a bouncer down the leg side, 146kph, he ducks
good one to finish with, back of a length outside off, shapes past the outside edge
over the wicket, short of a length, jumps behind the line and defends
full outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, hint of shape back in, defended
short of a length, solidly onto the back foot and defends to cover
banged in shorter, 141kph, gets on his toes and defends down by his feet
round the wicket, good length angled in at off stump, pushed firmly straight of mid-on
full at off stump, 147kph, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, 147kph, drives to the right of mid-off
a shorter delivery, angled into the hip, fended behind square
edged, but between third slip and gully, a terrific delivery from Starc, 149kph, it climbs from short of a length and takes the shoulder of the bat
fuller and straight, worked to mid-on
back of a length outside off, jumps a bit and takes the splice of the bat
short of a length at leg stump, takes the thigh pad
length ball at off stump, 137kph, defended to mid-off
a short ball, he goes for the pull and gets a big top edge which flies straight back over the keeper
a very short bouncer over his head
some width outside off, he slashes hard, playing the cut shot, flies in the air over the cordon
144kph, full at off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
full, angled into the pads, Australia start to appeal for lbw but it's just heading leg side
147kph, short of a length, straight and tucked to the on side
short outside off, pushed to the off side and they spot the chance for a quick single
very sharp! A 144kph bouncer, get Karunaratne hopping to get underneath it. Starc follows right through to finish by him
full outside off, mistimes a drive back to the bowler
touch short outside off, it turns, played square to point
well bowled, full at middle, straightens a touch and is pushed to mid-on
shorter, played off the back foot to the on side
full at off stump, gets forward and defends to silly point
angled into the pads, worked wide of short leg
full at the stumps, he plays back and defends down by the stumps
short outside off stump, a strong square drive finds point
gone with a direct hit! Dug out a full ball towards mid-on, runs as he hits it, goes straight to Cummins and Karunaratne was nowhere in the frame
143kph, short and angled down the leg side, manages to get the gloves and bat out of the line
144kph, full outside off, driven back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, punched square of the wicket to point
a short ball outside off, he sways out of the line
over the wicket, length ball outside off, left alone
nicely bowled, good length at off stump, shapes back at Thirimanne and defended to the bowler
left alone outside off
good length outside off, 136kph, defended to the covers
keeps it full at off stump, offering to shape back at the left hander, pushed to mid-on
well bowled, this one angles across from back of a length, a late decision to leave

through him! There's the first of the day...a lovely delivery, just short of a length, nips back off the seam, beats Karunaratne's forward push and just skims the leg stump. In fact, just clipped the leg bail. Both bowlers getting the ball to tail back today
banged in short at off stump, 143kph, defended on the back foot
short, angled across outside off, left alone
pushes this down the leg side
this is fuller, 147kph, but is down the leg side, diving take from Paine
on the pads, flicked backward of square to get off the mark
full and straight, clipped into that packed leg-side field
back of a length outside off, left alone
touch fuller, outside off, through to the keeper
this is pushed wider outside off, left alone
short of a length, 133kph, straight and worked to midwicket
clipped firmly off the pads, nearly sends it in the air but is just able to beat midwicket
full outside off, left alone
back of a length, straight, worked into midwicket
beats the outside edge as he aims to play a forcing back foot drive against a short-of-a-length delivery
that's a bit wayward, a short delivery which is pushed a long way down the leg side
fuller, very wide outside off, carries low through to Paine
very full, wide outside off, passes the batsman as a full toss and he misses the drive
angled into the pads, worked down to long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
a bouncer, 138kph, he ducks underneath
full at off stump, defended back down the pitch
full and straight, clipped strong off the pads to midwicket
short outside off, he's onto the back foot and pushes to cover
back of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
another batsman gets hit, ducking into a short ball and it balloons to second slip...came straight off the arm guard. Turning the head away as he ducked
that's played much better, short of a length outside off, stands tall and defends off the back foot
full at off stump, 143kph, defended back to the bowler
fuller, at the stumps, and met with a straight bat as he pushes this straight down the ground

edged, just carries to third slip! That's a sharp, low grab by Labuschagne. Chandimal is standing his ground so this will go upstairs. Soft signal is out. Back of a length at off stump, he's squared up, and that appears to have gone straight in. Fingers under the ball
short outside leg stump, flicked off the hip to long leg
full at off stump, 133kph, defended
a short delivery and that's a neat short-arm jab which races through midwicket, not sure Cummins is able to flick that back. Good effort. No, he flicks it into the rope
a bouncer, very short, through to Paine
round the wicket, fill at off stump, worked to midwicket
back of a length, angled in at the stumps, played to the leg side
on off stump, short of a length, defended down by his feet
short of a length, straight, worked to midwicket...there's a direct hit, think Thirimanne is safe. Yes, he is, but not the best piece of running
full toss outside off, 148kph, jabbed off the toe of the bat to gully. Not sure he entirely picked that up. Swung late
a short ball flung well down the leg side, Paine dives and parries it away one-handed
short again, straighter this time, he ducks underneath
full outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers
that's a well-directed bouncer, angling over middle and off, Dickwella plays it very well as he sways out of the line
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
defended into the covers
short outside off, it does turn though, pushed square into the covers
fuller, outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, square driven from the back foot to the covers
full outside leg stump, pushed into midwicket...was in the air for a little while
round the wicket, short of a length, pushed to midwicket
a bouncer, 135kph, ducks underneath
short of a length outside off, pushed to the covers
touch fuller, 138kph, outside off, he presses forward and it comes off the splice of the bat
there's an attempt to ramp over the slips! A short delivery, angling in from round the wicket, a late decision to try and send it over the slips. Almost glances it to Paine. Cummins smiles
solidly behind the line of a short-of-a-length delivery
full outside off, this one goes on straight as it's left alone
full at off stump, defended
touch shorter, driven square to point off the back foot
defended on the back foot back to the bowler
fuller, outside off, left alone
nearly gets him! This one slides on, he goes for the cut and it scoots over the top edge. There's Lyon's bounce coming into play
137kph, back of a length, fourth stump line, he's back and defending knocking it down into the off side
141kph, fuller length targeting off stump, he's sitting back in the crease and defending
over-pitched and he just whips the bottom and through it and cracks it down the ground straight of mid on! He didn't get far forward but he smoked it
140kph, shorter and wider, he's reaching away from the body and knocking it straight to point
139kph, bouncer, over off stump, he drops his knees and sways underneath it, keeping the hands and bat under the length
141kph, short again, lifting on off, he rides the bounce this time and knocking it down into the leg side, he wants one but is wisely sent back
86kph, slightly shorter, he's back and punching to the gap at point and Burns is reasonably deep and they take one
sharp spinning off break, catches the edge as he pushes forward, it runs well wide of slip fine of backward point and away for three
88kph, straighter on middle, he works this past short leg for an easy single
89kph, fuller outside off, he sweeps firmly forward of square to the sweeper in the deep
fractionally short and wide, he's back and cutting firmly to backward point
94kph, angled down leg, he just jabs this past short leg, it wasn't far away from Labuschagne's head, but it went very quickly into the gap
thick inside edge runs behind square after attempting a big cover-drive! It was just angled in enough to catch the inside edge
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending comfortably
138kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and working this wide of mid on
fuller, 140kph, on off, he pushes on the front foot to mid off
139kph, short ball, he tries to pull, gets a bottom edge onto thigh pad and it pops up but falls safely away from the stumps
142kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to point
88kph, shorter length, he's back to cut, it stays a touch low, he cuts to backward point
shorter and wider, he cuts very nicely, placing it into the gap between a fine backward point and the point fielder! Good shot
good length, drifting in and spinning away, he's forward and defending
fuller length, he steps forward and smothers the spin
good length, 90kph, he defends on the front foot with soft hands
87kph, quicker, slid through on middle, he defends on the back foot to short leg
135kph, bouncer, high over middle and he's under it easily
138kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending back to the bowler
141kph, back of a length into middle, he defends, cramped up, gets a thick inside edge that runs behind square

caught and bowled! Sensational athleticism from Cummins! This was a quick short ball, gets some extra bounce that gets big on Thirimanne, he tries to fend from in front of his face, it pops up off the shoulder of the bat, it ballooned back down the wicket, Cummins sprinted forward and to his left from his follow through, dives forward and takes the catch inches above the turf.
142kph, bouncer, very quick, he ducks underneath it
glorious straight drive! What a stroke to get off the mark. 143kph, over-pitched on off, he just leans forward and delivers the full face, timing it beautifully straight of mid on
he just thrashes this through cover-point off the back foot! It was wasn't that short or wide, he just threw his hands through it and nailed it in the gap!
straighter on middle, he sweeps easily behind square
shorter length, a bit of turn, he's back and tucking this behind square to the gap
87kph, ripping off break, out of the footmark, he misses trying to drive away from the body

edged and it flies between the keeper and slip! Khawaja diving right can't get a hand on it! Beautiful delivery, drifting in, turning away, a genuine edge defending, Khawaja was a touch wide and the nick went fine

88kph, good length, spitting and bouncing, he is back and defending off the outside edge along the ground well past slip, fine of backward point. They don't run initially! There was two there. Eventually they run one
137kph, good length, angled into middle and off, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
138kph, shorter length, he's back and up on his toes to defend
141kph, shorter into the ribs, he's back and working this nicely to fine leg
142kph, short ball outside off, he is withdrawing the bat and watching it fly past his chest
142kph, good length and wider, he crunches a square drive on the up but straight to point
142kph, bouncer, high and down leg, he's happy to duck under it
looped up outside off, he reaches out and sweeps behind square to the man in the deep
he reverse sweeps but mistimes it to backward point
86kph, on off, he sweeps with control behind square to wide fine leg
shorter length, 89kph, he's back and defending knocking it down
almost caught at short leg! Just short! It was looped up, he skips down, defends off the inside edge and it drops just short of the diving Labuschagne coming forward at short leg.
good length, off stump, he defends from the crease with soft hands
142kph, full angled into middle and leg, he drives uppishly but square of wide mid on into the gap
141kph, fuller outside off, he gets a good stride out and drives to mid off
shorter and wider of off, 143kph, he cuts easily to point but Richardson misfields, lets it through his legs to allow a run
beaten squared up! 140kph, back of a length, angled in and nipping off the seam, he was squared up trying to defend and missed it by some margin
141kph, shorter down the leg side it was too far down leg for Dickwella to catch up with it
142kph, short and wide, he cuts firmly but straight to point
good length off break, he defends from the crease, it comes off the thick inside half of the bat past short leg behind square
drifting down leg, he stays leg side but works this against the turn through square leg
88kph, shorter length, on leg, he pulls neatly behind square to wide fine leg
86kph, tossed up on leg, he defends tucking this behind square on the front foot
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and defends on the front foot
shorter length down leg, he knocks this down on the bounce to leg slip
147kph, over-pitched and he leans into a nice drive, doesn't try and overhit it, placing it wide of mid off

Bowled him! 147kph and it shot a touch low as he played from the crease! It was a fuller length, he stayed back, caught on the crease, it skidded lower, shot under the bat as he was squared up defending and crashed into off stump!

Caught behind! Inside edge! The double bluff! He was sitting back expecting a short ball, it was full outside off and tailing back a touch, he drives without any footwork, gets a thin inside edge and Paine moves forward to his right and takes a good catch just above the ground
he keeps it out! Good length, 148kph, angled into off, he defends from the crease jamming the bat down
133kph, this slips out of the hands, nearly missing the cut strip! Called wide. Starc checks the footmark. He might have slipped in the delivery stride
142kph, back of a length on off, he defends off the back foot through mid on and Starc has to chase it because there is no mid on!
144kph, angled down leg, he glances this wide of leg slip to fine leg
87kph, good length, he's back, it bounces, he's back and dropping this down with soft hands
fuller on middle, he strides out and works this to midwicket
good length on leg, he's back and working this past short leg to the gap
88kph tossed up outside off, he defends with the spin to midwicket
good length, he's back and defending with soft hands
85kph, looped up on middle, he clips this neatly to midwicket
round the wicket, full outside off, driven sweetly to mid-off
short of a length, pushed towards point and that's a tight run as Lyon picks up cleanly
gets behind the line of a short delivery, defends
gets inside the line and tucks to midwicket
short outside off, can't quite get over the top of it but manages to square drive wide of gully
clipped straight into short leg, that would have been one of those miraculous grabs you occasionally see in that position
short of a length at the body, flicks with extravagantly behind square on the leg side, in the air for a long way
fuller, at the pads, clipped firmly and not far from reaching the deep leg gully
outside off, back of a length, defended to point
full outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length, angled into the pads, deflects to the leg side off the inside edge

chipped straight to mid-on! A pretty weak shot, a good-length delivery on off stump, de Silva aiming to flick to the leg side, the bottom hand takes over and he just sends a pretty simple catch to mid-on. He's been keen to take everything leg side and it's cost him
round the wicket, short of a length, defended to the off side
across to off stump and defends square of the wicket
fuller, he comes forward and drives to mid-off
nicely guided through point with an open face off the back foot
a short ball angles over leg stump as he ducks
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
pushed outside leg, clipped deep into the on side
goes underneath a bouncer
short outside off, forces from the back foot to the covers
takes the splice of the bat as he defends to the on side
angled into the thigh pad, deflects to the leg side
back of a length, at off stump, pushed to the leg side
short of a length outside off, square drives to deep point
full outside off, pushed back down the pitch
short of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, he's across the crease and defends
148kph, an appeal for lbw as this angles into the pads, appeared to be heading leg stump as he was trapped on the crease
clipped off the pads to long leg, he's off the pair
136kph, a bouncer which he doesn't play
worked off the pads into square leg. Just a hint of reverse, perhaps, for Richardson
back of a length outside off, 131kph, defended to the bowler
this keeps low! Back of a length and targetting off stump, Mendis has to be quick to get the bat down
what's happened here? Full, moving back in, squares him up and beats the edge, takes the back pad but outside off stump
great shot! Drills a full delivery wide of mid-on with a straight bat. Hold the pose
round the wicket, good length at off stump, defended
gets forward and drives on the up to mid-off
short outside off, he's not in control of this at all, forcing off the back foot and it skews off an edge between the slips and gully
much more in control this time, plays back to a short-of-a-length delivery and punches to point
very full at the stumps, digs it out
back over the wicket, and dispatched! A half volley outside off, flayed through the covers in style
almost a stunning catch from Richardson, but always just out of reach as he ran back from mid-on. Mendis came down the pitch, tried to go straight down the ground, got too far underneath the ball
tucked off the pads to short leg
leans forward and defends
dragged down short, he pulls and hammers it into Labuschagne at short leg with the ball then rebounding away. That could have been nasty, very close to his throat
takes the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
goes for a big slog sweep, the ball was wide outside off, gets a top edge which flies over slip. Doesn't look like they want to do much blocking against Lyon
over the wicket, outside leg stump, flicked to long leg
a bouncer, he ducks
another short ball, doesn't quite bounce as much, as to go right down to avoid it
worked off the pads into square leg
a short delivery, defended on the back foot
short of a length at off stump, solidly and correctly behind the line
a wider line outside off, draws him onto the front foot
round the wicket, pushed across outside off, defended
worked off the pads to the leg side
goes back and across, deep in the crease, worked to the leg side
again he's across to off stump and works to the leg side
outside off this time, tucked into square leg to keep the strike
starts full at off stump, nicely tossed up, driven to cover
well bowled! That's the perfect leg-break, draws him forward and it spins past the outside edge
touch shorter outside off, pushed square into the off side
oops, that's a big full toss and it gets clubbed through the leg side
much better, back on a good length at off stump, hint of turn
dropped after three attempts by Khawaja at slip! A flashing drive, it flew quickly to Khawaja who couldn't grab it first time but nearly claimed it twice on the rebounds before it went to ground

brilliant effort at deep midwicket, almost a wonderful team-effort catch...Mendis slog swept, Burns grabbed it, knew he was going over the rope, and tried to flick it back to Richardson who was running round from long-on
short outside off, cut in front of square on the off side
flicked from outside off into midwicket
that's a meaty blow over deep midwicket, stays in his crease and swings through the line...just short of six
back of a length outside off, defended
almost pops off the inside edge to short leg but taking the bottom hand off the bat means he can just keep it down
full outside off, driven off a thick outside edge to backward point
well bowled again! Just short of a good length, spins sharply and bounces to beat the outside edge. Very nice
stretches forward and defends this leg-break to the off side
fuller, brings the drive and he finds cover
shorter, on the pads, worked into square leg
full, very wide, he has a wild drive and doesn't make contact
short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
fuller, brings him forward and he defends
uses his feet then defends
goes deep in the crease and tucks this around the corner
driven down the ground to long-on
flicks a shortish delivery from outside off to the leg side
90kph, leg break, good length on off, he defends off the outside half of the bat
tossed up higher outside off, he drives firmly with the spin to cover
shorter length, 89kph, wide of off, he leaves
slider, 92kph, on off, he spots it and defends on the front foot
big spinning leg break, wide of off, he leaves this alone

caught at cover! That was a bit soft. He looped up a leg break full and wide of off, he was tempted into a booming drive, he strides out but doesn't get all his weight over the front foot, and slaps the drive chest high to Patterson at cover! Easy catch.
131kph, good length but angled down leg, it comes off pad and runs fine to the keeper
bouncer, he tries to hook but it's too high for him and it bounces over the gloves
137kph, fuller on off, he defends on the front foot
caught behind! 138kph, good length wide of off, he is lured into a drive away from his body, he flashed hard, but got a thin edge and it flies straight through to Paine. Easy catch.
137kph, short into the hip, it comes off the thigh as he tries to fend away and it bounces to short leg
140kph, good length on off, he defends solidly on the front foot to mid off
edged off the back foot pushing at a back foot drive, it runs along the ground between slip and gully and away to third man!
142kph, fuller angled into off stump, he defends from the crease
143kph, good length angled into the top off, he defends from the crease

an appeal for caught behind down the leg side, given not out, Australia review. This was shorter down leg, he tried to glance off the hip. Leg side hot spot has nothing on it. Nothing on snicko. The decision remains not out
fuller, 142kph, wide of off, he pushes from the crease opening the face and running it to gully
139kph, good length wide of off, he leaves this alone
beaten, prodding and missing at a 135kph, good length delivery wide of off
137kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to mid off
134kph, bouncer, excellent short ball, he has to duck under it late
136kph, short into the ribs, he pops this up, pushing off the hip, it lands safely behind square for a single
136kph, wide of the crease, angled into off stump, he defends from the crease to mid on
136kph, cracking bouncer, he threw his hands up in front of face hoping not to get hit, it flew over his head to the keeper
144kph, full outside off, angling in a touch and shaping away, it beats the edge as he tries to drive
beats him again, tighter to off, but leaving the right hander again, he prods at it and misses
beaten three in a row. Another full ball angled in and tailing away, again he drives from the crease and misses
four plays and misses. A carbon copy of the last three, angled in and tailing past the edge
five plays and misses. This is getting amusing now. Too quick and again he prods at it outside off
he makes contact! Fuller outside off, he square drives with an open face to the man in the gully

caught behind! Perfect delivery. Would have got a lot of top order players out. 135kph, good length, fourth stump line, it wobbles away off the seam, he pushes at it from the crease, gets a thin edge through to Paine. The end is near
136kph, good length leg cutter, top of off, he's squared up defending to cover
searing bouncer, 134kph, he sways out of the way late but does well to get under it
139kph, fuller on middle, he defends popping this in the air towards mid on but it lands safe
136kph, he's edging but well short of slip, again squared up by a back of a length delivery seaming away
full and straight, he backs away and pokes at it nearly popping a return catch back to Cummins!
beaten again! Six in seven for Starc. Full angled in, tailing away, beats the edge. Starc is laughing
144kph, fuller on off, he defends on the front foot to the vacant point region, they have a mix up but eventually take an easy one
146kph, full and wide, feet anchored he waves the bat at it and misses
beaten and it just misses off stump! How did this miss!? He was squared up staying leg side, it beat the edge and just went past the top of off
147kph, dragged way down the leg side

Bowled him! Starc gets 10! Australia win! 146kph, searing yorker, gun barrel straight fired into the base of middle and off, he gets the feet out of the way and jams the bat down but misses and it crashes into the base of the stumps!
